column4: I have a problem if anyone want to take a shot at it, as a noob I am at my wits end.
ok
what program?
ctrl+alt+f1 log in there
try running it there
maybe run a command from console there for running X
goto console ctrl+alt+f1
and type the name of the program...what program is it?
ok just sec
in console type gnome-terminal --display=:0
did you try logggin in after ctrl alt f1 username and pass wrod and run the command above?
but you are unable to run programs right?
yes do it now
does it do it again after reboot?
maybe just check console and see ps -A look for something defunct and do a killall -9 program
next time you have the problem maybe
ps -A is to list processes and running programs
yes
maybe you already checked top to see it something was gombling memory  or using too much cpu or there was a defunct program
killall -9 firefox-bin will killall firefoxs otherwise if that fails you do kill -9 process id a shown under ps -A
by console i mean ctrl+alt+f1. yes you can do this while everything isrunning even X
you still with us?
you with us??
